intro: Senecio spathulifolius subsp. campestris, commonly known as the Campestris groundsels, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its rosette-forming structure and large, spoon-shaped leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers arranged in a composite head, typical of the daisy family. It is native to southern Africa and thrives in dry, sunny environments. Due to its striking appearance, it is often cultivated as an ornamental plant.
